result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Harold Scott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in Court, in custody.  Attorney John c Glover appeared by video for Aaron Harold Scott.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing with Defendant's other case, 22CF765. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Glover was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office and has NOT received discovery material. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 11. Status hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held in 113 of the Safety Building.

Received and Filed.
Attorney John Glover.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in Court, in custody.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF765. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Case adjourned for Order to Show Cause hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. If counsel has not been appointed by the next date, Court will appoint counsel at county expense. 
Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 04:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court. Defendant in custody. Attorney Jacob Corr appeared on behalf of Attorney Eric Bashirian for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF765. Discussion placed on the record. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. If no counsel is appointed by next hearing, Court will set an Order to Show Cause hearing. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held in room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with attorney Ashley Fard. Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Motion hearing with Defendant's other case 22CF765. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the court of Defendant's request for new counsel. Statements made by Defendant. State did not object. For reasons seated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense's Motion to Withdraw. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. Court VACATED September 19, 2022 Jury Trial date. Court TOLLED TIME LIMITS for the Speedy Trial Demand. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 1:30 pm. Hearing will be held in room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding Defendant's request for new counsel. 
Motion to Withdraw hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:15 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to MCSO.

Attorney Ashley Fard in Court, Defendant Aaron Harold Scott not in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian on behalf of Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Final Pretrial. Defendant also has Case 22CF764 scheduled today - case was incorrectly transferred to Branch 46. Due to COVID-19 protocol, Defendant was not able to be produced for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense previously requested to address Bail, and provided notice to the State and Court. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial, Branch 46.  Final PreTrial scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Expires October 24, 2022
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
State's Witness List; received and filed.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Statements made regarding discovery material. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 9:45 am.Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Jury Trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Attorney Ashley Fard in Court, Defendant Aaron Harold Scott not in Court, in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material; however, has NOT received an offer from the State. Defendant also has a case pending in Branch 38. Court ordered Defense and State to meet/talk at least 48 hours in advance of the next hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Wilson.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in Court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  Jacob Daniel Corr on behalf of Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF765 (Branch 38). Defendant and Defense appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. State appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Fard was really appointed by the Public Defender's Office, pending a conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Ashley Fard

Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron Harold Scott appeared by video means.
SPD needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Last time case will be adjourned for inital appearance.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Douglas L.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Aaron Harold Scott in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
